metadata.title: How to make Ottappam Or Ottada- South Indian Rice Pancake
metadata.description:
How to make Ottappam or Ottada- South Indian Rice Pancake, breakfast speciality. Ottappam is made in a claypan.
Recipe: http://www.thasneen.com/cooking/ottappam-or-ottada-recipe-ottappam-made-in-a-clay-pan-rice-pancakes/

Ingredients
Rice flour- 1½ cups
Eggs- 2
Water- ¾ cup
Salt- a couple of pinches

Instructions
You have to use clay pan to make this, it won't come out good in a non-stick pan.
If you are using a new clay pan, season the pan well before you make this.
In a blender, grind the flour, eggs, water and salt together to a smooth paste.
Heat the clay pan over medium high heat.
Grease the pan with non-stick cooking spray.
Pour a large spoonful of batter and spread thin.
Ottappam can be served with curry or coconut milk and sugar.

en: [00:00.000] How to make Ottappam or Ottada, South Indian rice pancake.
[00:04.500] This is a breakfast speciality and Ottappam is made in a clay pan.
[00:08.800] Ingredients needed are rice flour, eggs, water and salt.
[00:13.200] You have to use a clay pan to make this, it will not come out good in a non-stick pan.
[00:18.000] If you are using a new clay pan, season the pan well before using it.
[00:23.500] Rub the pan with egg shells a few times, rinse with water and use it.
[00:28.800] In a blender, grind the flour, eggs, water and salt to a smooth paste.
[00:34.500] The batter should not be too thick and not too thin.
[00:38.900] Heat the clay pan over medium high heat and grease it lightly.
[00:43.500] Pour a spoonful of batter and spread it into a thin small round shape.
[00:48.000] Holes will start forming in the middle and it cooks very fast.
[00:52.000] Remove the ottappam and serve with curry or coconut milk and sugar.
